clumpCode: Decision is made to deploy apps to stores.
If not working on the Mac already, time to start up the Mac, Docker, and Jenkins

Observe: No containers are active in the Containers panel.

Subsequent Docker Desktop startups may show two containers stopped (but not active):
- 'jenkins-blueocean' (the Jenkins controller) and
- 'flutter-node' (the primary agent).

Double check that all shell scripts are set with:
> `chmod +x scriptname.sh` (e.g. `755`).

This includes not only the scripts in the 'jenkins-docker' structure,
  but the scripts in the app's 'tools' folder as well.

This directory houses
- `runmac.sh`,
- `runj.sh`,
- `stopj.sh`,
- `DockerfileAgent`,
- `DockerfileController`, and
- a `flutter` subfolder.

This needs to be run each time Docker Desktop is started (at least it did in my case).

Note: Be sure to replace 'macuser' with your own Mac login/home user.

Expected output when running this command:

srwxr-xr-x@ 1 macuser  staff  0 Dec  5 23:29 /Users/macuser/.docker/run/docker.sock
... ... ... before ^^^

... ... ... Need Mac/host local password for: 'chown' and 'chmod':
Password:

... ... ... after vvv
srw-rw----@ 1 root  docker  0 Dec  5 23:29 /Users/macuser/.docker/run/docker.sock

... ... ... Confirm: srw-rw----@ 1 root  docker

This starts up the Jenkins DinD, Jenkins controller, and a Jenkins agent.

CONTAINER_NAME_JENKINS="jenkins-docker"
CONTAINER_NAME_BLUEOCEAN="jenkins-blueocean"
CONTAINER_NAME_FLUTTER="flutter-node"

# Sample Output

macuser@MacUser-MBP jenkins-docker % ./runj.sh  

... ... ... begin

Check for: [660 && root : docker] (on /Users/macuser/.docker/run/docker.sock)

To double check ownership, run:

> docker exec -it flutter-node bash
> ls -la /var/run/docker.sock
If not set to root:docker...
> sudo chown root:docker /var/run/docker.sock

Jenkins is starting up. You can access it at http://jenkins-blueocean:8080

clumpName: PRE-CONFIG: Build the Flutter Environment Docker Image for Jenkinsfile usage
clumpCode:
This section should be done and run prior to the first Jenkins build,
  and for subsequent Flutter environment upgrades (although not the
  Flutter framework, for which the latest is always retrieved).

The files for this section are in the 'jenkins-docker lutter' folder.

- Update the 'runf.sh' file with your own Docker Hub info.
- Check and update the `DockerfileFlutter` file as needed.

This will build the image with the Flutter environment.

The final image can be stored in a private repo on Docker Hub.

> CLI: ./runf.sh  # Build current version
> CLI: ./runf.sh push  # Build and push current version
> CLI: ./runf.sh 1.0.1  # Build a previous version (will replace latest)
> CLI: ./runf.sh 1.0.0 push  # Build and push a previous version (will replace latest)

clumpName: Start Jenkins Agent on Mac host (for iOS builds)
clumpCode:
When building to iOS, an IPA must be created in a Mac-based environment,
  for which we can use our host Mac by giving it its own agent.

This does not mean Jenkins needs to be installed on the host Mac
  (which is what the Jenkins Docker containers are for) — the agent is just a component or library service.

Note though: Xcode, Flutter and fastlane will need to be installed and up to date on the host Mac.

clumpName: CLI: Open a new terminal window
clumpCode:
Although the host Mac agent can be set to run as a background task,
  I keep it running so I can monitor any issues.
The host Mac agent is run from a sibling 'jenkins-docker' folder.

Run a script to:
- determine if a new app version and release notes are needed,
- merge the 'main' branch into the 'build_release' branch, then
- trigger the Jenkins build*.

* If git is set to watch the 'build_release' branch, the build trigger can be removed from the script.
All CI/CD shells scripts are stored in each app's own 'tools' directory.
[run deploy] This script will execute the steps mentioned above.

clumpName: Monitor Jenkins progress across two pipelines
clumpCode:
If the primary Jenkins pipeline job succeeds, Android will have been deployed
  and a 2nd Jenkins pipeline will be started to build and deploy iOS.
